sessions.title: Precon Registration
Harnessing the Power of Microsoft Fabric - Accelerating Insights with OneLake, Power BI, and Synapse
sessions.description:
In this session, we will explore the incredible potential of Microsoft Fabric, a cutting-edge data platform designed to unlock the full power of your data and artificial intelligence (AI). With its robust suite of capabilities, Microsoft Fabric empowers organizations to leverage data effectively and extract actionable insights. Join us as we dive into the key components of Microsoft Fabric, including OneLake, the revolutionary “OneDrive for data” solution that simplifies data storage, organization, and sharing. From leveraging lakehouses and notebooks, to data warehousing and data movement with Pipelines and Dataflows, we will also delve into how this empowers Power BI, Microsoft’s leading business intelligence tool, which allows users to visualize data and gain valuable insights through interactive dashboards and reports.

What will you learn?

What is OneLake and why is it so revolutionary?
Building your Lakehouse in Fabric
Mastering Data warehousing in Fabric
Orchestrating with pipelines and dataflows
Understanding Power BI’s role in Fabric

sessions.title: Unlocking AI Potential for the Data Professional: Azure OpenAI
sessions.description:
Are you ready to unleash the full potential of artificial intelligence? Whether you’re a seasoned Data Professional or just dipping your toes into the world of machine learning, our full-day session will empower you with the knowledge to create groundbreaking solutions.

Why Attend?
•	AI & Azure OpenAI Unveiled: Get an exclusive introduction to Azure Open AI, a comprehensive suite of tools and services designed to empower developers like you.
•	Cutting-Edge Insights: Dive into the latest breakthroughs in natural language processing, computer vision, conversational AI, and generative models.
•	Harness the Fusion: Discover how the synergy between artificial intelligence and cloud computing can revolutionize your business and data projects.
•	Hands-On Collaboration: Engage in collaborative exercises where you’ll team up with fellow participants. Together, you’ll design robust architectures and make informed decisions about AI project implementation.
•	Scalability and Security: Learn how to build scalable, secure, and responsible AI/Data solutions using Azure OpenAI.

Key Takeaways
By the end of this session, you’ll walk away with:
1.	Deep Understanding: A solid grasp of the Azure Open AI ecosystem and its capabilities.
2.	Decision-Making Superpowers: The ability to make informed choices when it comes to AI project design and deployment.
3.	Modern Guidance: Valuable insights and practical tips to elevate your AI projects to new heights.

session.title: Precon Registration
Harnessing the Power of Microsoft Fabric - Accelerating Insights with OneLake, Power BI, and Synapse
session.description:
In this session, we will explore the incredible potential of Microsoft Fabric, a cutting-edge data platform designed to unlock the full power of your data and artificial intelligence (AI). With its robust suite of capabilities, Microsoft Fabric empowers organizations to leverage data effectively and extract actionable insights. Join us as we dive into the key components of Microsoft Fabric, including OneLake, the revolutionary “OneDrive for data” solution that simplifies data storage, organization, and sharing. From leveraging lakehouses and notebooks, to data warehousing and data movement with Pipelines and Dataflows, we will also delve into how this empowers Power BI, Microsoft’s leading business intelligence tool, which allows users to visualize data and gain valuable insights through interactive dashboards and reports.

What will you learn?

What is OneLake and why is it so revolutionary?
Building your Lakehouse in Fabric
Mastering Data warehousing in Fabric
Orchestrating with pipelines and dataflows
Understanding Power BI’s role in Fabric

session.title: Unlocking AI Potential for the Data Professional: Azure OpenAI
session.description:
Are you ready to unleash the full potential of artificial intelligence? Whether you’re a seasoned Data Professional or just dipping your toes into the world of machine learning, our full-day session will empower you with the knowledge to create groundbreaking solutions.

Why Attend?
•	AI & Azure OpenAI Unveiled: Get an exclusive introduction to Azure Open AI, a comprehensive suite of tools and services designed to empower developers like you.
•	Cutting-Edge Insights: Dive into the latest breakthroughs in natural language processing, computer vision, conversational AI, and generative models.
•	Harness the Fusion: Discover how the synergy between artificial intelligence and cloud computing can revolutionize your business and data projects.
•	Hands-On Collaboration: Engage in collaborative exercises where you’ll team up with fellow participants. Together, you’ll design robust architectures and make informed decisions about AI project implementation.
•	Scalability and Security: Learn how to build scalable, secure, and responsible AI/Data solutions using Azure OpenAI.

Key Takeaways
By the end of this session, you’ll walk away with:

2.	Decision-Making Superpowers: The ability to make informed choices when it comes to AI project design and deployment.
3.	Modern Guidance: Valuable insights and practical tips to elevate your AI projects to new heights.

sessions.title: SQL Clinic Open
SQL Clinic Open
SQL Clinic Open
SQL Clinic Open

Ice Cream Break - Visit Sponsors
Ice Cream Break - Visit Sponsors
Break - Visit Sponsors
Break - Visit Sponsors
Break - Visit Sponsors
Final Break - Head to Raffle
Registration - Breakfast
Modeling & Transforming Data Using DBT
sessions.description: This demonstration will introduce the audience to the basics of transforming and modeling data using dbt (Data Build Tool). We will transform data during a live demo from source ingestion to a semantic model ready for consumption. Growing in popularity, this SQL based tool has an impressive set of functionality and potential application for your modern data engineering environment. By the end of the presentation, you will understand what dbt is, what it does well, and when to use it in your projects.

sessions.title: AI-Driven Healthcare: The Future with Azure's Text Analytics
sessions.description:
How can AI redefine the handling of electronic health records? Discover the transformative power of Azure's Text Analytics in healthcare.

This session delves into the integration of Azure's Text Analytics for health in the Clinical Translator, emphasizing its role in analyzing unstructured text and enhancing data quality. We'll explore its advanced features and demonstrate how it contributes to more efficient healthcare data management.

Attendees will gain a deeper understanding of Azure's Text Analytics' capabilities and how it can be harnessed to streamline healthcare workflows, improve data accuracy, and support evidence-based patient care.

sessions.title: What do Graph Tables bring to the table
sessions.description:
There are many ways to represent data. Most of us are stuck with relational database data models, and we don't feel comfortable when data is represented differently.
Graph Processing Tables are another way to represent data; they can change how you look at the data. Relational Databases don't adapt well to changes. Adding a new domain or relation to your data model should not be that difficult. You want to create flexible data models that evolve with your business process.
Thanks to SQL Server, you can integrate the knowledge gained in this session into your business without investing in new or unapproved technologies.

Please Join me to learn how to create flexible data models with Graph Database tables.

sessions.title: Charting New Territories: Unleashing Power BI's Custom Maps
sessions.description: In this session, we will explore the limitations and successes of mapping geographic data in Power BI. After exploring, the amazing features hidden in plain sight, we will dive deep into using geoJSON files to customize our maps. But the icing on the cake, is our custom topoJSON file creation and importation into Power BI. Users will be left ready to layer their own reports with amazing maps that tailor their data to new extremes!

sessions.title: Generative AI: Concepts, Tools, and Applications for Data Professionals
sessions.description: Generative AI is a branch of artificial intelligence that can create new data or content by learning from existing content. It has applications in various domains such as text, image, audio, video, and code generation. In this session, you will learn how generative AI works, its limitations, the main tools and processes you can use, and where you can use it to enhance your data estate and data projects. You will also explore examples of how generative AI can help you with code generation, debugging, and optimization tasks. You will examine a complete solution using SQL SErver Machine Learning Services and Azure OpenAI integration. This session is suitable for data professionals who have some familiarity with machine learning and want to learn more about the potential and effective uses of generative AI.

sessions.title: 26 Tips across the Power Platform
sessions.description:
This session will go through 26 tips & tricks ranging from beginner - advanced. Topics may include:

(There will be a heavy emphasis on Power BI) 

-Power Automate tutorial
-Data modeling tips
-Shortcuts & tricks in Power BI (Data Viz)
-Git integration for Power BI Dev
-Advanced DAX calculations
-Power Query parameter tables

You may know some, you may know none, but I promise you'll leave learning something along the way.

sessions.title: Power up your Fabric Development with DAX Studio and Tabular Editor
sessions.description:
Whether you are just starting on your Power BI Journey or an experienced Power BI developer these tools enhance your development and analysis of your data. This session will cover connecting to Power BI Desktop, Power BI Premium Workspaces, and Fabric Workspaces to meet you where you currently are. DAX Studio and Tabular Editor are part of the study guide for the DP-600 exam for Fabric, so this is the perfect time to start learning how to put them to good use.

The first tool we will look at is DAX Studio. Its strength is being able to analyze your data separately from Power BI and Fabric. You can use it to quickly gather statistics about multiple semantic models. Has a user reported that one of the reports is running slow? You can use DAX Studio to do DAX performance tuning to make it faster. 

The second tool is Tabular Editor 2.  It gives you the ability to check to see if your models are following best practices. You can make changes to your models whether they are running in Power BI Desktop, Power BI Premium, or Fabric Workspaces. With Tabular Editor you can use scripts to automate changes that if done manually could take days.

These are just some of the topics we will cover as we learn how valuable these tools can be. This session will have the greatest benefit to someone new to DAX Studio and Tabular Editor regardless of where you are on your Fabric journey.

sessions.title: Dimensional Data Modeling in Power BI for the Beginner
sessions.description:
Power BI works at its best when Data Model is based on Star Schemas achieved applying Dimensional Data Modeling practices. In my experience as a Data Consultant and a Trainer, I find that one of the biggest struggles Power BI Professionals face, is having a bad Data Model design, which then leads to: bad performance, incorrect results displaying, complex (sometimes considered impossible) DAX calculations to be used, and a Data Model that ends up not being clear nor scalable.

If you are completely new or just starting with Dimensional Data Modeling for Power BI, this session is for you! We will focus on basic concepts and terminologies, building a Star Schema Design from scratch and finally applying the Design using Power BI Desktop and Power Query.

sessions.title: 4 Examples of using Power Automate and Power Apps IN Power BI
sessions.description:
In this fast-paced session, Belinda will use an existing Power BI Reports, reporting on ERP (Accounting and Distribution) data, adding Power Apps and Power Automate flows to enrich the user experience and efficiency.  The ability to utilize apps and flows within a Power BI report allows you to act on your analysis without ever leaving the page.  During this session we will:
•	Build a Power App to change data at the source
•	Build multiple Power Automate flows
o	   Utilizing Paginated Reports
o	   Refreshing Data 
•	More
If you have never used the apps and flows in your Power BI Report, this session is for you!

sessions.title: ‘So Many Power BI Features, So Little Time: Susan’s Top Ten Best’
sessions.description:
With the Power BI Team cranking out monthly updates and new features at a mind-boggling rate, it’s hard to keep up with the new preview features.  To help you cut through the white noise, join Susan as she shows off her top ten favorites.
There are many new features to try each month, but we don’t have time to test everything in the real world.  So, let’s review the most value-added items we can put into play today in our models; ones that will bring along a ‘wow’ factor with a true value-add!  Keep in mind, this list is not even close to an extensive one.
The May 2023 Fabric Rollout aside, we’ll start the list with creative ways to leverage Field Parameters [previewed 2022], moving on to the New Card visual, Explore! In the Service, DAX INFO Functions, storytelling in PowerPoint and the list goes on…. well at least for 10 items; we only have one hour.  We can also debate the On-Object Interaction functionality, which takes a little time to get used to and then you can’t live without it!
To get the full list; come on over for a lively discussion and demo rich presentation.  There is always something new to learn; let’s learn together!

sessions.title: Getting started with the SQL Language
sessions.description:
SQL is a programming language used for interacting with Relational Databases. This session is for beginners looking for an introduction to the SQL Language: covering the basics, syntax, important aspects and considerations. We will make a special focus on querying databases using SELECT to retrieve data, including finding, filtering, and joining tables.

No previous knowledge required; basic relational database understanding would be beneficial.

sessions.title: SQL SERVER ON AZURE VM - CONFIGURING FOR PRICE-PERFORMANCE
sessions.description:
When selecting a virtual machine to host your SQL Server workload in Azure, you need to choose a virtual machine size that provides optimal performance and fits your organization’s budget. 

There are a number of different compute and storage options in Azure, so choosing the configuration that gives you the best price-performance for your workload can be a challenge.

In this session, we will cover topics such as the different virtual machine types that are most appropriate for SQL Server workloads (including the new Ebdsv5 series), configuring storage, SQL Sand features unique to Azure such as host caching and write acceleration that can help boost your performance without breaking the bank.

sessions.title: T-SQL Tips, Tricks, Hacks, and Backdoors - the undocumented goodies
sessions.description: There are some uncommon practices in the T-SQL Language that allows the author to short cut long tedious tasks, bend the rules for data scrubbing, and some times flat out make your own rules when an out of the box solution is necessary.

sessions.title: Exploring the new performance "bugs", I mean, "features" of SQL2022
sessions.description:
The intelligent query processing (IQP) feature family includes features with broad impact that improve the performance of existing workloads with minimal implementation effort to adopt.

In this session we'll explore the the many features that comprise IQP. We'll see not only the good benefits of the features that work fine on AdventureWorks, but also some important considerations, limitations and potential improvements on the features.

sessions.title: Teaching Old Dogs New Tricks:  Revitalizing a SQL Server Code Base One Version at a Time
sessions.description: Data assets at organizations tend to stick around for a while--many of the databases we work with are old enough to vote.  These databases tend to be full of code and patterns which made sense in SQL Server 2005 but are not the best approach today.  In this session, we will walk through what has changed in the T-SQL landscape over the past several versions of SQL Server, providing practical tips on how to improve an existing code base without installing new SQL Server components.  Just because that database is old doesn't mean it has to look that way.

sessions.title: SQL Server vs Azure Cosmos DB
sessions.description:
Do you need to move your legacy application to the cloud? or maybe you need to select a database for a new cloud project. This session will help you by comparing the functionalities of Azure SQL and Azure Cosmos DB in detail.

We will start the session by explaining the differences between distributed databases and centralized databases. We will compare indexing, stored procedures, partitioning, constraints, and scaling in these two great products. Next, 
We will explore the available tools and languages to query and maintain the Azure Cosmos DB. Finally, we will compare the query optimization engine and execution plans between the two database engines.

This session will help you to understand and make the right decision for your upcoming cloud projects.

sessions.title: Indexing 101: How to find your data in monoliths, documents, lakes and more.
sessions.description:
Do you remember your Intro to Database class?
Learning about indexes?  Well, times have changed since my DB 101 class!
In this session, we will take a deeper dive into the way indexes have evolved over time and look at Indexes in a new light.  Whether you are a beginner or vetran, this session will help you gain insights into the world of big data, new paradigms in indexing and examples of what works where.

sessions.title: Index R(x): Prescriptions for Performance Improvement
sessions.description:
Need SQL Server to go faster? Fix your indexes!

There are 1000’s of SQL community scripts to make indexes better. But almost all help with just one piece of the puzzle. You've still got to copy and paste and format and link each result just to see a glimpse of the bigger picture.

What if you could ...
- Grab data from all SQL sources with one script ...
- Aggregate results by Index > Table > Database > Instance …
- Create diagnoses by Index, Table, Database, Instance …
- Prescribe actions for every Index …
- Prioritize actions by Table ...
- And use Excel for analysis and presentation?

That's SQLXL_Index - a new tool designed to make index tuning simpler and more comprehensive for SQL developers and administrators.

Prerequisites: a good understanding of SQL Server index types and uses. Experience using operational, usage, and statistic metrics in identifying index pain points. Working knowledge of one or more of the popular SQL scripts and libraries, such as sp_Blitz_Index, Glenn Berry's Diagnostic Queries, Aaron Bertrand's 40 Queries, or similar.

sessions.title: Use AI To Make Your Data Job Easier (and More Fun)
sessions.description: Even a casual glance at the news lately shows that AI and the things it can do is all the rage. Is a lot of it overblown hype? Yes. But, does it enable technical professionals to do more than they could before? Also yes! I've been working with Azure AI for six years and it is exciting to see the convergency between low-code/no-code development tools and the power of AI in the cloud. Join me for this demo-rich session where I show you how AI-powered and connected tools can help you do your job more efficiently, help you have a little more fun at work, and possibly help you leverage your new found AI knowledge to a new job!

sessions.title: Exceptions, temp tables and code regression
sessions.description: Try/Catch, #temp, ##temp or @temp, inner/left/outer joins and other T-SQL fundamentals to improve your database developer role

sessions.title: Red-Teaming your own prompts
sessions.description:
Generative AI can create wonderful but also horrible things. With it come new types of risks and attack vectors on systems.

In this session the presenter talks about some of his experiences trying to understand risks and limitations by "red-team"ing his own usage.

The presenter will share observations he made as to some of the patterns that he believes can often circumvent prompt- or content filter-based protections.

With plenty of hands-on examples some of the unique properties of Large Language Models will be explored, and the cat-and-mouse game between attackers and defenders will be discussed.

You will also hear about various attack vectors that you may need to defend against when building AI systems based on Large Language Models or even building Large Language Models.

Furthermore you will also get some insights into existing "off-the-shelf" solutions such as various Copilots that can be exposed through Red-Teaming and gain an understanding how your own solutions may be subject to similar attacks.

sessions.title: Rules and Tools for Power BI Accessibility
sessions.description: How much of your Power BI report design is focused on accessibility? If the answer is none, you're not alone. Report accessibility is often an afterthought at best. Fortunately, there are simple rules and tools to make it easy for you and you'll find that once you integrate these into your design process, you will undoubtedly end up with beautiful and effective reports for a much broader audience. We'll go over tools such as the Report Accessibility Checklist, the Accessibility Checker, and the color contrast checker. You won't look at accessibility as optional again!

sessions.title: Bridging the Gap: Evaluating the Impact of Investment on Women in Technology and Addressing Bias
sessions.description: Despite substantial investments from various organizations aimed at bolstering the representation and success of Women in Technology (WIT), the sector continues to grapple with the challenges of bias and underrepresentation. This panel will critically assess the current status of WIT, examining the effectiveness of such investments and identifying areas where expectations have not yet been met. It will highlight the strides made in creating more inclusive technologies and corporate cultures, while also acknowledging the persistence of bias—both conscious and unconscious—that impedes progress. The panel, comprising leading female technologists, diversity and inclusion advocates, and policymakers, will provide a multifaceted perspective on the interplay between gender bias and technology. Through a data-driven approach, we will explore the advancements in AI and machine learning to mitigate biases in hiring and career advancement, the role of mentorship programs, and the impact of policy changes within tech organizations. Moreover, the discussion will offer insights into how the technology created by a more diverse workforce is better equipped to serve a varied user base, leading to more innovative and equitable tech solutions. This session aims to foster a dialogue that not only reflects on the investments made but also charts a course for a more equitable future in technology, where women's contributions are fully recognized and valued.

sessions.title: Real-Time Analytics with Microsoft Fabric: Tracking the International Space Station
sessions.description: One of the most incredible advents of Microsoft Fabric is the capability to easily stand up Event Stream to consume real-time streaming data that can be consumed by Kusto, KQL, Databases.  In this session we will show how to track the International Space Station as it circles the Earth.  We will do this using a Logic App, consuming the data with a Microsoft Fabric Event Stream, processing the data and then writing it to a KQL Database.  We will then show how using Direct Lake in Power BI we can refresh the report at a 5 second interval, effectively tracking the Space Station as it circles the globe!

sessions.title: Deciphering Data Architectures (Modern Data Warehouse, Data Fabric, Data Lakehouse, Data Mesh)
sessions.description: Data fabric, data lakehouse, and data mesh have recently appeared as viable alternatives to the modern data warehouse. These new architectures have solid benefits, but they’re also surrounded by a lot of hyperbole and confusion. In this presentation I will give you a guided tour of each architecture to help you understand its pros and cons. I will also examine common data architecture concepts, including data warehouses and data lakes. You’ll learn what data lakehouses can help you achieve, and how to distinguish data mesh hype from reality. Best of all, you’ll be able to determine the most appropriate data architecture for your needs. And I’ll finish with discussing Microsoft’s version of the data mesh.

sessions.title: Lakehouse Plumbing - Building Metadata Driven Pipelines
sessions.description: If you are adopting cloud data technologies, you more than likely are going to need to move data up in them clouds so an ETL/pipeline process may be in your future.  Time and time again I have seen a pattern emerge that was helpful with my customers…metadata driven pipelines.  In this demo heavy session, we'll go through how to set them up in Azure Data Factory/Synapse Analytics.  We'll also look at how to set them up in Microsoft Fabric and compare those options.  By the end of this session, we may be calling ourselves pro data lakehouse plumbers.

sessions.title: Introducing Microsoft Fabric: The All-in-One Analytics Solution
sessions.description:
The world is awash with data and it is up to data professionals to make sense of it all. That's where Microsoft next generation of analytics platform comes in: Microsoft Fabric!

Fabric is a complete end-to-end analytics platform bringing together Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse, and Power BI in a single location and more deeply integrated than ever. It’s built on a SaaS platform which helps deliver innovation more quickly and allowing users to get up and running in seconds. At the core Fabric provides a lake-centric and open data hub using the popular Delta format with built-in security, governance, and compliance throughout. At the edge, Fabric delivers flexibility for data scientists, data warehouse developers, and Power BI users to build and analyze using their unique skill sets.

During this session we will discuss the guiding principles and architecture behind Fabric and show a lot of demos! Whether you’re a data engineer, data scientist, data warehouse developer, or an existing Power BI user, Fabric has something for everyone. You won’t want to miss this session!

sessions.title: Harnessing the Power of Microsoft Fabric
sessions.description: In this session, we will explore the incredible potential of Microsoft Fabric, a cutting-edge data platform designed to unlock the full power of your data and artificial intelligence (AI). With its robust suite of capabilities, Microsoft Fabric empowers organizations to leverage data effectively and extract actionable insights. Join us as we look at how to use your data to drive your insights across your organization using the latest advances.

sessions.title: How to Elevate Cloud HA/DR on a Budget
sessions.description: Discover SIOS DataKeeper, the SANless clustering solution transforming HA/DR for SQL Server across any cloud. This session highlights how SIOS DataKeeper delivers unparalleled flexibility, reduces costs, and ensures continuous availability without traditional SAN constraints. Learn about its seamless integration, real-time replication, and automatic failover capabilities, designed for operational excellence in environments like Azure, AWS, and Google Cloud. Ideal for those aiming to deploy or optimize SQL Server cloud architectures, this presentation provides key insights into achieving cost savings while maintaining reliability. Join us to revolutionize your HA/DR strategy with SIOS DataKeeper.

sessions.title: Azure AI Studio: Orchestration, Prompt Flow and Copilots
sessions.description:
Discover the power of Azure AI Studio for full lifecycle development of generative AI applications using your own data. From prompt engineering to deploying copilots, Azure AI Studio offers a unified platform equipped with pre-built Azure AI skills, multi-modal application development, and advanced evaluation tools.

Why You Should Attend:

Discover how Azure AI Studio provides a centralized environment for prompt engineering, enabling seamless integration of language, vision, and speech capabilities into your AI applications.

Deploy an Azure OpenAI Model and Chat with Your Data: Explore the deployment of an Azure OpenAI model and engage in insightful conversations with your company's data, laying the groundwork for copilot training.

Custom Orchestration with Prompt Flow: Gain insights into the custom orchestration capabilities of Azure AI Studio's prompt flow tool, empowering you to guide the behavior of your applications to better fit your specific use case requirements.

Deploy the Flow for Consumption: Take the final leap by deploying your well crafted copilot flow for consumption, empowering your company with an AI-driven assistant ready to enhance customer interactions and streamline operations.

sessions.title: Analytics at the speed of Direct Lake
sessions.description: Join Patrick Leblanc and Phil Seamark for a deeper dive to discover what makes Direct Lake so fast.  This session will cover important elements of monitoring and optimizing your Fabric data platform to unlock the full potential of Direct Lake, such as how to interpret Delta Analyzer logs and what to look out for if things slow down.

sessions.title: Copilot in Power BI
sessions.description: Learn how this AI-powered digital assistant can help you with tasks such as writing DAX, creating synonyms, and building reports. Built on technologies from OpenAI, Copilot is designed to provide personalized assistance and suggestions, while respecting user-specific permissions and only generating responses based on information you have access to. Discover how Copilot can help you unleash your creativity, unlock productivity, and improve your skills in Power BI.

sessions.title: Essential Soft Skills for the Modern DBA
sessions.description:
A career as a professional database administrator can be both extremely challenging AND rewarding at the same time.  It’s a role that requires a broad range of skills to be truly successful.  The most obvious are the technical.  But just as vital, are factors like dedication, time management, problem-solving, interpersonal skills, patience, level-headedness, and even a good sense of logic!

As a SQL DBA for over two decades, I’ve learned more than a thing or two on this and would absolutely love to share my thoughts and insights into exactly what soft skills you can concentrate on to rocket forward in your career as a database administrator.  Please join me for this informal non-technical discussion.

sessions.title: Should I become a manager in IT
sessions.description: Buck Woody has had IT management positions at organizations from the US Military to Healthcare, Manufacturing and now at Microsoft. In this session he'll cover the decision points in your career that you need to understand for becoming a manager, the traits you should have, the training you need to be successful, and the ways you can help your employees and organization thrive.

sessions.title: Who Is On Call For You?
sessions.description: While there are many conference sessions that tackle the technical bits of how to handle an on call role in the data world, there are not many sessions that ponder the toll that these roles can take on someone. I've spent most of my career inside and alongside on call roles in the data and infrastructure space and I've seen the negative impacts they can have on someone's health and wellness. Take some time for yourself during this year's event and spend an hour listening to some tips and tricks for managing the mental and physical stress that comes from being in an on call role. If you're currently in a role like that, my hope is that you'll find this session helpful. Even if you're not in a role like that, come listen and learn how to better support your colleagues who are doing their best to keep your data and infrastructure available.

sessions.title: Leadership Principles Uncovered...
sessions.description: There are many Managers in this world and every once in a while we come across a leaders.  We will go on a Journey as to what is a leader and what we can do to improve our ability to stay ahead of the curve and become a better leader.

sessions.title: Power BI Basics! Design and Deliver Power(ful) BI Reports
sessions.description:
Have you struggled with presenting tabular/raw data effectively using the Power BI platform?

In this session you will learn a variety of ways to load & transform data, some report design techniques learned through years of on-hand experiences, and lastly you will learn how to create reports and dashboards that any busy Data Analyst can successfully implement.

sessions.title: Introduction to Automated Database Deployments with Azure DevOps
sessions.description: Moving database code from development to QA to UAT and eventually production can be a project in of itself.  This is especially true when multiple projects might be across multiple repositories.  Keeping track of the correct set of builds for a release can be challenging.  With Azure DevOps, this challenge can be eliminated with pipelines.  This session will step through the process to build and release multiple projects in the same pipeline.  Opportunities for adding approvals will also be covered.

sessions.title: How to Weave DataOps into Microsoft Fabric
sessions.description: Are you looking at upgrading from Power BI Pro or Premium Per User to Fabric?  Are you struggling with managing issues with datasets, dataflows, reports, and dashboards which reduces the time your project team has to build new products?  Learn how DataOps can help you improve project delivery, reduce errors, and which features in Fabric weave DataOps principles into the platform.

sessions.title: Introduction to Automated Database Deployments with GitHub
sessions.description:
Developing database changes is just the beginning. Once the code has been committed to source control, moving code between environments can be cumbersome in a manual environment. When multiple changes over time are involved in a release, tracking the proper set of changes is critical. Otherwise, the quality assurance team may test incompatible builds, leading to wasted time and potentially allowing unsupported changes to be deployed together.

This session will introduce database developers and administrators to GitHub code repositories and GitHub Actions to define a build and deployment workflow for an Azure SQL database. Several workflow portions will be explained more in-depth, highlighting different tasks written in YAML.

sessions.title: Building a cloud based data pipeline from raw data to visualization
sessions.description: In this presentation, we take a look at a real use case where we need to create a cloud based big data pipeline from unstructured raw data and build a data visualization solution to enable business decisions. We use these technologies:  Python, Jupyter notebook, SQL, GitHub, Docker, Data Lake, Data Orchestration and Data Modeling for incremental data process into the Data Warehouse, which serves the data to Visualization tools like Looker or Power BI.

sessions.title: Database Project 0 to 100 in 60
sessions.description: Only two slides and then we dive in. Basic navigation tools followed by handling of handling databases that reference each other followed by ignoring client objects with a single common structure. Bring your questions and we will dig in!

sessions.title: Private Endpoints for Microsoft Fabric, what it means to you?
sessions.description: On that session, we will explore network security options for Microsoft Fabric, and the implications of those on your analytics projects.

sessions.title: Microsoft Fabric: Import on Premise Data from SQL Server (& More!)
sessions.description:
The number one question that people have is "How do I get my On-Premises data into Microsoft Fabric!?!".  We support a lot of data sources, and we have a few different ways that we can import data into Microsoft Fabric from On Premise.

In this session we will go through them.  How do we set up and use a Power BI Data Gateway to get data?  How do we use our existing Self Hosted Integration Runtimes to get data?  What services do we use?

You have questions and, in this session, we have the answers!

sessions.title: Microsoft Fabric: Data Mesh Architecture
sessions.description: As more customers get their hands on Fabric, there is a growing need to understand data mesh architecture and what it looks like within Microsoft Fabric. Having different requirements for security access, data residency, data usage, and many other factors, across different teams within your organization leads to the important architecture design concept of Data Mesh. Many organizations have an existing data mesh architecture today across many services, and in this session, we will explore what data mesh architecture looks like in Fabric and how you can start to mesh your existing architecture with Fabric as well.

sessions.title: Maximizing Data Performance: Unlocking the Power of Delta Tables
sessions.description: Discover the essentials of Delta tables in this dynamic session. We'll focus on how Delta tables revolutionize data processing, offering faster, more reliable performance. Learn about key features like ACID transactions and scalable metadata handling, and see how they fit into your data strategies. With practical tips and case examples, you'll walk away with actionable insights to enhance your data operations. Perfect for data professionals eager to elevate their systems with cutting-edge technology. Join us to transform your data landscape with Delta tables!

sessions.title: Introduction to Azure Data Factory
sessions.description: Your boss comes in one day and says that your company has decided to move to Azure and they want you to get up to speed on Azure Data Factory (ADF). Has this happened to you? If not, it may be coming!  Currently your processes use SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) and now you need to learn the basics of ADF just to get your existing processes converted. Or perhaps you have been wanting to learn more about how to load data using Azure Data Factory? If this is you, please join me in this introductory session where I will provide a quick overview and demonstration on loading a data mart in Azure Data Factory.

sessions.title: Securing an Azure SQL Database
sessions.description: Protecting the data is one of the prime responsibilities of the DBA. During this session we will cover some of the features of Azure and Azure SQL Database that will help make our data more secure.  These features include Transparent Data Encryption, Always Encrypted and Data Masking.

sessions.title: Who Cares About Relational Database Design?
sessions.description:
It has been nearly 45 years since the concept of a relational database management system (RDBMS) was written down by Edgar Codd. If you work with any technology besides databases, something written down 45 minutes ago may already be obsolete. So why does relational design still matter?

I will answer that question by showing how to design a database, including the common normal forms and how they make data easy to work with (even if you are not using an RDBMS). Many typical database programming "difficulties" result from struggling against how data should be structured and can be avoided by applying basic normalization techniques. Most of these techniques are common sense, but some subtleties cause every designer to occasionally struggle with them, even when the code gives the correct answer (For example, why can't you write:
WHERE ColumnName like '%son' 
and the optimizer figure out how to use an index?).

sessions.title: Why Should I Care About ... The Plan Cache
sessions.description: SQL Server is a huge product, with many different places a DBA can go to look for information on how the server is performing. So many in fact that they can often overlap, which sometimes makes it hard to understand why tackling a new tool is worth the effort. In this first (and hopefully not last) installment of Rick’s “Why should I care” series a case for why working knowledge of how to query the plan cache is critical for performance tuning efforts in real world environments, followed by a review of relevant DMV’s for the newly motivated audience. Perfect for those who are relatively new to performance tuning concerns, or advanced DBAs trying to figure out how to have a similar conversation with their less experienced peers, or developers who are curious as to why their DBA is sometimes so moody.

sessions.title: This is not your daddy's backup routine
sessions.description: Microsoft introduced a new backup support back in SQL 2016 when the data files are in Azure Storage Accounts. It was yet another cloud native feature in SQL. After 6 years it has finally made its way to on-prem storage. In this session we will deep dive in the snapshot backup option, target to large volume data bases.

sessions.title: Tame Your Unruly Data With Constraints
sessions.description: Bad data comes in many forms: duplicate rows, wrong data type, invalid values, and orphaned or missing foreign keys. Time is wasted cleansing, reviewing and correcting data, not to mention the potential hazards bad data can cause. This introductory presentation will explain the data types and constraints available in SQL Server, and how they can replace or augment business rules that would otherwise be written in application or procedure code. Performance benefits provided by constraints will be demonstrated. We will examine the various system views and procedures that describe constraints and how to use them to document your databases. You will be able to apply this knowledge to your database environments and see significant improvements in data quality, performance, and reliability.

sessions.title: Optimizing SQL Server HA/DR Costs in Azure: Key Strategies & Demos
sessions.description: In this technical session, we delve into the realm of High Availability (HA) and Disaster Recovery (DR) for SQL Server deployments in Azure, focusing on cost-efficient methodologies. The session aims to provide a comprehensive understanding and practical demonstrations of three key technologies: Basic Availability Groups, SQL Server Failover Cluster Instances (FCI) with Azure Shared Disks, and Azure Site Recovery. Attendees will gain insights into each method's architecture, setup, and operational nuances. We will specifically emphasize how to optimize costs without compromising on reliability and performance. The session is structured to benefit both newcomers and seasoned professionals in the field of cloud-based SQL Server deployments. By the end of this session, participants will be equipped with the knowledge to make informed decisions about HA/DR strategies in Azure, ensuring both economic efficiency and robustness in their SQL Server environments.

sessions.title: Always On: Lessons learned (that Microsoft doesn’t tell you)!
sessions.description:
In this session, we will talk about the practical lessons learned in the implementation and administration of several Microsoft SQL Server's Always On Availability Groups and Failover Cluster Instances.
 From navigating the complexities of configuration to overcoming common "pitfalls" we will show you insights from the real world and stories that are not so well-documented. Whether you are an experienced administrator or a beginner in high availability solutions, this session will help you gain knowledge about the potential of SQL Server's Always On feature.

sessions.title: Log Shipping for SQL Server
sessions.description: This session will cover the features and administration of log shipping in SQL Server. We will describe the basics of transaction logs, high availability and disaster recovery, and how log shipping can be used in those scenarios. We will demonstrate the Log Shipping Wizard, and also use the stored procedures to script a log shipping configuration. We will also demonstrate customized log shipping for scenarios where the built-in log shipping may not be adequate, such as log shipping from on-premises to cloud locations. We will also discuss how log shipping can be used to migrate to an Availability Group configuration, and other scenarios.

sessions.title: Running High IO SQL Server Workloads in the Cloud
sessions.description: We all have that one or two "whales in the pond" that we need to migrate to the cloud and know they can't go Azure SQL or even Managed Instance.  What options are there to run these IO intensive SQL workloads in the cloud?  This session will cover the ins and outs, including options for reaching high IO, no matter the workload.

sessions.title: The hitchhiker's guide for keeping your SQL Server Always On
sessions.description:
In today's fast-paced business environment, high availability is critical for any SQL Server deployment. The SQL Server Always On Availability Groups feature is a powerful tool that provides a high level of availability and disaster recovery protection for your mission-critical databases. However, implementing and maintaining a robust Always On infrastructure can be challenging. 
In this session, we will dive into the world of SQL Server Always On Availability Groups and explore the best practices for keeping your SQL Server Always On by combining other features as well. We will cover the key components of an Always On deployment, including cluster configuration, network settings, database configuration, and monitoring. We will also discuss common issues that can impact the availability of your SQL Server environment and how to address them.

You will learn:
	• How to design and deploy a highly available SQL Server Always On infrastructure
	• Best practices for configuring and managing Always On Availability Groups
	• How to monitor and troubleshoot common issues with your Always On deployment
	• Tips and tricks for ensuring maximum availability and performance of your SQL Server environment
	
Whether you are a SQL Server dba, database developer, or IT professional responsible for managing SQL Server deployments, this session will provide you with the knowledge and tools you need to keep your SQL Server Always On and minimize its downtime.

sessions.title: Intro to PowerShell with dbatools for the DBA
sessions.description: Whether you manage a single instance of SQL Server or hundreds of them, PowerShell and dbatools are invaluable additions to your toolbox. Today, we’re going to scratch the surface with what you can do with these tools to simplify, automate and standardize some of the tasks you perform.

sessions.title: SQL Server 2022: Integrating Query Store with Intelligent Query Processing
sessions.description: SQL Server 2022 has made significant improvements at optimizing query performance.  Since the introduction of the Query Store (QS) in version 2016 and subsequent rollouts of Intelligent Query Processing (IQP) features in later versions, these enhancements have revolutionized the approach of performance tuning and query optimization. This presentation touches on the historical development of these features and explains how these features now work together to add greater value in version 2022.  Specifically, it will cover the framework of the Query Store for identifying and resolving query performance issues, detail the innovations introduced with the IQP features, and explain how these features work together to automate some of query tuning process. Attendees will gain valuable insights into leveraging the Query Store to swiftly pinpoint performance bottlenecks, understand the mechanics and benefits of the latest IQP enhancements, and master the combined use of QS and IQP for optimal query performance. This session is tailored for both database administrators (DBAs) and developers, aiming to equip them with advanced skills and knowledge to significantly improve their SQL Server performance tuning practices.

sessions.title: The T-SQL PIVOT/UNPIVOT Operators
sessions.description: Ever wish your horizontal data were vertical for easier data storage, as well as vice-versa for reporting purposes? Are you writing elaborate routines to transform between them for one-time usage? Are your queries repeating “OUTER JOIN” or “UNION” so often that you wind up back in Kansas when you read them aloud? Let's visit SQL Server’s lesser-known PIVOT and UNPIVOT operators. After this session, you will no longer need to rotate your monitor!

sessions.title: Solving DBA Problems with Powershell
sessions.description: Let's face it, our data estates are growing while our Database Administration teams are not. How do we handle this? I will show you how PowerShell can transform common DBA tasks into easily packaged scripts that are faster and less error prone. When you leave, you will be equipped to solve DBA issues faster and be prepared for the ever-changing database landscape.

sessions.title: PowerShell For the SQL Server DBA
sessions.description: During this session we will cover the basics of PowerShell and how we can use it to help us do our job.  We will go over the fundamentals of PowerShell including some basic commands.  We will also go over the places in the SQL Server environment that PowerShell can be used.  This session is for the DBA who has little or no knowledge of PowerShell

sessions.title: Raffle

session.title: Registration - Breakfast
Modeling & Transforming Data Using DBT
session.description: This demonstration will introduce the audience to the basics of transforming and modeling data using dbt (Data Build Tool). We will transform data during a live demo from source ingestion to a semantic model ready for consumption. Growing in popularity, this SQL based tool has an impressive set of functionality and potential application for your modern data engineering environment. By the end of the presentation, you will understand what dbt is, what it does well, and when to use it in your projects.

session.title: 26 Tips across the Power Platform
session.description:
This session will go through 26 tips & tricks ranging from beginner - advanced. Topics may include:

(There will be a heavy emphasis on Power BI) 

-Power Automate tutorial
-Data modeling tips
-Shortcuts & tricks in Power BI (Data Viz)
-Git integration for Power BI Dev
-Advanced DAX calculations
-Power Query parameter tables

You may know some, you may know none, but I promise you'll leave learning something along the way.

session.title: Getting started with the SQL Language
session.description:
SQL is a programming language used for interacting with Relational Databases. This session is for beginners looking for an introduction to the SQL Language: covering the basics, syntax, important aspects and considerations. We will make a special focus on querying databases using SELECT to retrieve data, including finding, filtering, and joining tables.

No previous knowledge required; basic relational database understanding would be beneficial.

session.title: SQL Server vs Azure Cosmos DB
session.description:
Do you need to move your legacy application to the cloud? or maybe you need to select a database for a new cloud project. This session will help you by comparing the functionalities of Azure SQL and Azure Cosmos DB in detail.

We will start the session by explaining the differences between distributed databases and centralized databases. We will compare indexing, stored procedures, partitioning, constraints, and scaling in these two great products. Next, 
We will explore the available tools and languages to query and maintain the Azure Cosmos DB. Finally, we will compare the query optimization engine and execution plans between the two database engines.

This session will help you to understand and make the right decision for your upcoming cloud projects.

session.title: Red-Teaming your own prompts
session.description:
Generative AI can create wonderful but also horrible things. With it come new types of risks and attack vectors on systems.

In this session the presenter talks about some of his experiences trying to understand risks and limitations by "red-team"ing his own usage.

The presenter will share observations he made as to some of the patterns that he believes can often circumvent prompt- or content filter-based protections.

With plenty of hands-on examples some of the unique properties of Large Language Models will be explored, and the cat-and-mouse game between attackers and defenders will be discussed.

You will also hear about various attack vectors that you may need to defend against when building AI systems based on Large Language Models or even building Large Language Models.

Furthermore you will also get some insights into existing "off-the-shelf" solutions such as various Copilots that can be exposed through Red-Teaming and gain an understanding how your own solutions may be subject to similar attacks.

session.title: Introducing Microsoft Fabric: The All-in-One Analytics Solution
session.description:
The world is awash with data and it is up to data professionals to make sense of it all. That's where Microsoft next generation of analytics platform comes in: Microsoft Fabric!

Fabric is a complete end-to-end analytics platform bringing together Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse, and Power BI in a single location and more deeply integrated than ever. It’s built on a SaaS platform which helps deliver innovation more quickly and allowing users to get up and running in seconds. At the core Fabric provides a lake-centric and open data hub using the popular Delta format with built-in security, governance, and compliance throughout. At the edge, Fabric delivers flexibility for data scientists, data warehouse developers, and Power BI users to build and analyze using their unique skill sets.

During this session we will discuss the guiding principles and architecture behind Fabric and show a lot of demos! Whether you’re a data engineer, data scientist, data warehouse developer, or an existing Power BI user, Fabric has something for everyone. You won’t want to miss this session!

session.title: Essential Soft Skills for the Modern DBA
session.description:
A career as a professional database administrator can be both extremely challenging AND rewarding at the same time.  It’s a role that requires a broad range of skills to be truly successful.  The most obvious are the technical.  But just as vital, are factors like dedication, time management, problem-solving, interpersonal skills, patience, level-headedness, and even a good sense of logic!

As a SQL DBA for over two decades, I’ve learned more than a thing or two on this and would absolutely love to share my thoughts and insights into exactly what soft skills you can concentrate on to rocket forward in your career as a database administrator.  Please join me for this informal non-technical discussion.

session.title: Introduction to Automated Database Deployments with Azure DevOps
session.description: Moving database code from development to QA to UAT and eventually production can be a project in of itself.  This is especially true when multiple projects might be across multiple repositories.  Keeping track of the correct set of builds for a release can be challenging.  With Azure DevOps, this challenge can be eliminated with pipelines.  This session will step through the process to build and release multiple projects in the same pipeline.  Opportunities for adding approvals will also be covered.

session.title: Private Endpoints for Microsoft Fabric, what it means to you?
session.description: On that session, we will explore network security options for Microsoft Fabric, and the implications of those on your analytics projects.

session.title: Securing an Azure SQL Database
session.description: Protecting the data is one of the prime responsibilities of the DBA. During this session we will cover some of the features of Azure and Azure SQL Database that will help make our data more secure.  These features include Transparent Data Encryption, Always Encrypted and Data Masking.

session.title: Optimizing SQL Server HA/DR Costs in Azure: Key Strategies & Demos
session.description: In this technical session, we delve into the realm of High Availability (HA) and Disaster Recovery (DR) for SQL Server deployments in Azure, focusing on cost-efficient methodologies. The session aims to provide a comprehensive understanding and practical demonstrations of three key technologies: Basic Availability Groups, SQL Server Failover Cluster Instances (FCI) with Azure Shared Disks, and Azure Site Recovery. Attendees will gain insights into each method's architecture, setup, and operational nuances. We will specifically emphasize how to optimize costs without compromising on reliability and performance. The session is structured to benefit both newcomers and seasoned professionals in the field of cloud-based SQL Server deployments. By the end of this session, participants will be equipped with the knowledge to make informed decisions about HA/DR strategies in Azure, ensuring both economic efficiency and robustness in their SQL Server environments.

session.title: Intro to PowerShell with dbatools for the DBA
session.description: Whether you manage a single instance of SQL Server or hundreds of them, PowerShell and dbatools are invaluable additions to your toolbox. Today, we’re going to scratch the surface with what you can do with these tools to simplify, automate and standardize some of the tasks you perform.

session.title: SQL Clinic Open
Break - Visit Sponsors
AI-Driven Healthcare: The Future with Azure's Text Analytics
session.description:
How can AI redefine the handling of electronic health records? Discover the transformative power of Azure's Text Analytics in healthcare.

This session delves into the integration of Azure's Text Analytics for health in the Clinical Translator, emphasizing its role in analyzing unstructured text and enhancing data quality. We'll explore its advanced features and demonstrate how it contributes to more efficient healthcare data management.

Attendees will gain a deeper understanding of Azure's Text Analytics' capabilities and how it can be harnessed to streamline healthcare workflows, improve data accuracy, and support evidence-based patient care.

session.title: Power up your Fabric Development with DAX Studio and Tabular Editor
session.description:
Whether you are just starting on your Power BI Journey or an experienced Power BI developer these tools enhance your development and analysis of your data. This session will cover connecting to Power BI Desktop, Power BI Premium Workspaces, and Fabric Workspaces to meet you where you currently are. DAX Studio and Tabular Editor are part of the study guide for the DP-600 exam for Fabric, so this is the perfect time to start learning how to put them to good use.

The first tool we will look at is DAX Studio. Its strength is being able to analyze your data separately from Power BI and Fabric. You can use it to quickly gather statistics about multiple semantic models. Has a user reported that one of the reports is running slow? You can use DAX Studio to do DAX performance tuning to make it faster. 

The second tool is Tabular Editor 2.  It gives you the ability to check to see if your models are following best practices. You can make changes to your models whether they are running in Power BI Desktop, Power BI Premium, or Fabric Workspaces. With Tabular Editor you can use scripts to automate changes that if done manually could take days.

These are just some of the topics we will cover as we learn how valuable these tools can be. This session will have the greatest benefit to someone new to DAX Studio and Tabular Editor regardless of where you are on your Fabric journey.

session.title: SQL SERVER ON AZURE VM - CONFIGURING FOR PRICE-PERFORMANCE
session.description:
When selecting a virtual machine to host your SQL Server workload in Azure, you need to choose a virtual machine size that provides optimal performance and fits your organization’s budget. 

There are a number of different compute and storage options in Azure, so choosing the configuration that gives you the best price-performance for your workload can be a challenge.

In this session, we will cover topics such as the different virtual machine types that are most appropriate for SQL Server workloads (including the new Ebdsv5 series), configuring storage, SQL Sand features unique to Azure such as host caching and write acceleration that can help boost your performance without breaking the bank.

session.title: Indexing 101: How to find your data in monoliths, documents, lakes and more.
session.description:
Do you remember your Intro to Database class?
Learning about indexes?  Well, times have changed since my DB 101 class!
In this session, we will take a deeper dive into the way indexes have evolved over time and look at Indexes in a new light.  Whether you are a beginner or vetran, this session will help you gain insights into the world of big data, new paradigms in indexing and examples of what works where.

session.title: Rules and Tools for Power BI Accessibility
session.description: How much of your Power BI report design is focused on accessibility? If the answer is none, you're not alone. Report accessibility is often an afterthought at best. Fortunately, there are simple rules and tools to make it easy for you and you'll find that once you integrate these into your design process, you will undoubtedly end up with beautiful and effective reports for a much broader audience. We'll go over tools such as the Report Accessibility Checklist, the Accessibility Checker, and the color contrast checker. You won't look at accessibility as optional again!

session.title: Harnessing the Power of Microsoft Fabric
session.description: In this session, we will explore the incredible potential of Microsoft Fabric, a cutting-edge data platform designed to unlock the full power of your data and artificial intelligence (AI). With its robust suite of capabilities, Microsoft Fabric empowers organizations to leverage data effectively and extract actionable insights. Join us as we look at how to use your data to drive your insights across your organization using the latest advances.

session.title: Should I become a manager in IT
session.description: Buck Woody has had IT management positions at organizations from the US Military to Healthcare, Manufacturing and now at Microsoft. In this session he'll cover the decision points in your career that you need to understand for becoming a manager, the traits you should have, the training you need to be successful, and the ways you can help your employees and organization thrive.

session.title: How to Weave DataOps into Microsoft Fabric
session.description: Are you looking at upgrading from Power BI Pro or Premium Per User to Fabric?  Are you struggling with managing issues with datasets, dataflows, reports, and dashboards which reduces the time your project team has to build new products?  Learn how DataOps can help you improve project delivery, reduce errors, and which features in Fabric weave DataOps principles into the platform.

session.title: Microsoft Fabric: Import on Premise Data from SQL Server (& More!)
session.description:
The number one question that people have is "How do I get my On-Premises data into Microsoft Fabric!?!".  We support a lot of data sources, and we have a few different ways that we can import data into Microsoft Fabric from On Premise.

In this session we will go through them.  How do we set up and use a Power BI Data Gateway to get data?  How do we use our existing Self Hosted Integration Runtimes to get data?  What services do we use?

You have questions and, in this session, we have the answers!

session.title: Who Cares About Relational Database Design?
session.description:
It has been nearly 45 years since the concept of a relational database management system (RDBMS) was written down by Edgar Codd. If you work with any technology besides databases, something written down 45 minutes ago may already be obsolete. So why does relational design still matter?

I will answer that question by showing how to design a database, including the common normal forms and how they make data easy to work with (even if you are not using an RDBMS). Many typical database programming "difficulties" result from struggling against how data should be structured and can be avoided by applying basic normalization techniques. Most of these techniques are common sense, but some subtleties cause every designer to occasionally struggle with them, even when the code gives the correct answer (For example, why can't you write:
WHERE ColumnName like '%son' 
and the optimizer figure out how to use an index?).
