session.description:
In this session, we will talk about the practical lessons learned in the implementation and administration of several Microsoft SQL Server's Always On Availability Groups and Failover Cluster Instances.
 From navigating the complexities of configuration to overcoming common "pitfalls" we will show you insights from the real world and stories that are not so well-documented. Whether you are an experienced administrator or a beginner in high availability solutions, this session will help you gain knowledge about the potential of SQL Server's Always On feature.

session.title: SQL Server 2022: Integrating Query Store with Intelligent Query Processing
session.description: SQL Server 2022 has made significant improvements at optimizing query performance.  Since the introduction of the Query Store (QS) in version 2016 and subsequent rollouts of Intelligent Query Processing (IQP) features in later versions, these enhancements have revolutionized the approach of performance tuning and query optimization. This presentation touches on the historical development of these features and explains how these features now work together to add greater value in version 2022.  Specifically, it will cover the framework of the Query Store for identifying and resolving query performance issues, detail the innovations introduced with the IQP features, and explain how these features work together to automate some of query tuning process. Attendees will gain valuable insights into leveraging the Query Store to swiftly pinpoint performance bottlenecks, understand the mechanics and benefits of the latest IQP enhancements, and master the combined use of QS and IQP for optimal query performance. This session is tailored for both database administrators (DBAs) and developers, aiming to equip them with advanced skills and knowledge to significantly improve their SQL Server performance tuning practices.

session.title: SQL Clinic Open
Break - Visit Sponsors
Lunch
Bridging the Gap: Evaluating the Impact of Investment on Women in Technology and Addressing Bias
session.description: Despite substantial investments from various organizations aimed at bolstering the representation and success of Women in Technology (WIT), the sector continues to grapple with the challenges of bias and underrepresentation. This panel will critically assess the current status of WIT, examining the effectiveness of such investments and identifying areas where expectations have not yet been met. It will highlight the strides made in creating more inclusive technologies and corporate cultures, while also acknowledging the persistence of bias—both conscious and unconscious—that impedes progress. The panel, comprising leading female technologists, diversity and inclusion advocates, and policymakers, will provide a multifaceted perspective on the interplay between gender bias and technology. Through a data-driven approach, we will explore the advancements in AI and machine learning to mitigate biases in hiring and career advancement, the role of mentorship programs, and the impact of policy changes within tech organizations. Moreover, the discussion will offer insights into how the technology created by a more diverse workforce is better equipped to serve a varied user base, leading to more innovative and equitable tech solutions. This session aims to foster a dialogue that not only reflects on the investments made but also charts a course for a more equitable future in technology, where women's contributions are fully recognized and valued.

session.title: How to Elevate Cloud HA/DR on a Budget
session.description: Discover SIOS DataKeeper, the SANless clustering solution transforming HA/DR for SQL Server across any cloud. This session highlights how SIOS DataKeeper delivers unparalleled flexibility, reduces costs, and ensures continuous availability without traditional SAN constraints. Learn about its seamless integration, real-time replication, and automatic failover capabilities, designed for operational excellence in environments like Azure, AWS, and Google Cloud. Ideal for those aiming to deploy or optimize SQL Server cloud architectures, this presentation provides key insights into achieving cost savings while maintaining reliability. Join us to revolutionize your HA/DR strategy with SIOS DataKeeper.

session.title: Break - Visit Sponsors
What do Graph Tables bring to the table
session.description:
There are many ways to represent data. Most of us are stuck with relational database data models, and we don't feel comfortable when data is represented differently.
Graph Processing Tables are another way to represent data; they can change how you look at the data. Relational Databases don't adapt well to changes. Adding a new domain or relation to your data model should not be that difficult. You want to create flexible data models that evolve with your business process.
Thanks to SQL Server, you can integrate the knowledge gained in this session into your business without investing in new or unapproved technologies.

Please Join me to learn how to create flexible data models with Graph Database tables.

session.title: Dimensional Data Modeling in Power BI for the Beginner
session.description:
Power BI works at its best when Data Model is based on Star Schemas achieved applying Dimensional Data Modeling practices. In my experience as a Data Consultant and a Trainer, I find that one of the biggest struggles Power BI Professionals face, is having a bad Data Model design, which then leads to: bad performance, incorrect results displaying, complex (sometimes considered impossible) DAX calculations to be used, and a Data Model that ends up not being clear nor scalable.

If you are completely new or just starting with Dimensional Data Modeling for Power BI, this session is for you! We will focus on basic concepts and terminologies, building a Star Schema Design from scratch and finally applying the Design using Power BI Desktop and Power Query.

session.title: T-SQL Tips, Tricks, Hacks, and Backdoors - the undocumented goodies
session.description: There are some uncommon practices in the T-SQL Language that allows the author to short cut long tedious tasks, bend the rules for data scrubbing, and some times flat out make your own rules when an out of the box solution is necessary.

session.title: Index R(x): Prescriptions for Performance Improvement
session.description:
Need SQL Server to go faster? Fix your indexes!

There are 1000’s of SQL community scripts to make indexes better. But almost all help with just one piece of the puzzle. You've still got to copy and paste and format and link each result just to see a glimpse of the bigger picture.

What if you could ...
- Grab data from all SQL sources with one script ...
- Aggregate results by Index > Table > Database > Instance …
- Create diagnoses by Index, Table, Database, Instance …
- Prescribe actions for every Index …
- Prioritize actions by Table ...
- And use Excel for analysis and presentation?

That's SQLXL_Index - a new tool designed to make index tuning simpler and more comprehensive for SQL developers and administrators.

Prerequisites: a good understanding of SQL Server index types and uses. Experience using operational, usage, and statistic metrics in identifying index pain points. Working knowledge of one or more of the popular SQL scripts and libraries, such as sp_Blitz_Index, Glenn Berry's Diagnostic Queries, Aaron Bertrand's 40 Queries, or similar.

session.title: Real-Time Analytics with Microsoft Fabric: Tracking the International Space Station
session.description: One of the most incredible advents of Microsoft Fabric is the capability to easily stand up Event Stream to consume real-time streaming data that can be consumed by Kusto, KQL, Databases.  In this session we will show how to track the International Space Station as it circles the Earth.  We will do this using a Logic App, consuming the data with a Microsoft Fabric Event Stream, processing the data and then writing it to a KQL Database.  We will then show how using Direct Lake in Power BI we can refresh the report at a 5 second interval, effectively tracking the Space Station as it circles the globe!

session.title: Azure AI Studio: Orchestration, Prompt Flow and Copilots
session.description:
Discover the power of Azure AI Studio for full lifecycle development of generative AI applications using your own data. From prompt engineering to deploying copilots, Azure AI Studio offers a unified platform equipped with pre-built Azure AI skills, multi-modal application development, and advanced evaluation tools.

Why You Should Attend:

Discover how Azure AI Studio provides a centralized environment for prompt engineering, enabling seamless integration of language, vision, and speech capabilities into your AI applications.

Deploy an Azure OpenAI Model and Chat with Your Data: Explore the deployment of an Azure OpenAI model and engage in insightful conversations with your company's data, laying the groundwork for copilot training.

Custom Orchestration with Prompt Flow: Gain insights into the custom orchestration capabilities of Azure AI Studio's prompt flow tool, empowering you to guide the behavior of your applications to better fit your specific use case requirements.

Deploy the Flow for Consumption: Take the final leap by deploying your well crafted copilot flow for consumption, empowering your company with an AI-driven assistant ready to enhance customer interactions and streamline operations.

session.title: Who Is On Call For You?
session.description: While there are many conference sessions that tackle the technical bits of how to handle an on call role in the data world, there are not many sessions that ponder the toll that these roles can take on someone. I've spent most of my career inside and alongside on call roles in the data and infrastructure space and I've seen the negative impacts they can have on someone's health and wellness. Take some time for yourself during this year's event and spend an hour listening to some tips and tricks for managing the mental and physical stress that comes from being in an on call role. If you're currently in a role like that, my hope is that you'll find this session helpful. Even if you're not in a role like that, come listen and learn how to better support your colleagues who are doing their best to keep your data and infrastructure available.

session.title: Introduction to Automated Database Deployments with GitHub
session.description:
Developing database changes is just the beginning. Once the code has been committed to source control, moving code between environments can be cumbersome in a manual environment. When multiple changes over time are involved in a release, tracking the proper set of changes is critical. Otherwise, the quality assurance team may test incompatible builds, leading to wasted time and potentially allowing unsupported changes to be deployed together.

This session will introduce database developers and administrators to GitHub code repositories and GitHub Actions to define a build and deployment workflow for an Azure SQL database. Several workflow portions will be explained more in-depth, highlighting different tasks written in YAML.

session.title: Microsoft Fabric: Data Mesh Architecture
session.description: As more customers get their hands on Fabric, there is a growing need to understand data mesh architecture and what it looks like within Microsoft Fabric. Having different requirements for security access, data residency, data usage, and many other factors, across different teams within your organization leads to the important architecture design concept of Data Mesh. Many organizations have an existing data mesh architecture today across many services, and in this session, we will explore what data mesh architecture looks like in Fabric and how you can start to mesh your existing architecture with Fabric as well.

session.title: Why Should I Care About ... The Plan Cache
session.description: SQL Server is a huge product, with many different places a DBA can go to look for information on how the server is performing. So many in fact that they can often overlap, which sometimes makes it hard to understand why tackling a new tool is worth the effort. In this first (and hopefully not last) installment of Rick’s “Why should I care” series a case for why working knowledge of how to query the plan cache is critical for performance tuning efforts in real world environments, followed by a review of relevant DMV’s for the newly motivated audience. Perfect for those who are relatively new to performance tuning concerns, or advanced DBAs trying to figure out how to have a similar conversation with their less experienced peers, or developers who are curious as to why their DBA is sometimes so moody.

session.title: Log Shipping for SQL Server
session.description: This session will cover the features and administration of log shipping in SQL Server. We will describe the basics of transaction logs, high availability and disaster recovery, and how log shipping can be used in those scenarios. We will demonstrate the Log Shipping Wizard, and also use the stored procedures to script a log shipping configuration. We will also demonstrate customized log shipping for scenarios where the built-in log shipping may not be adequate, such as log shipping from on-premises to cloud locations. We will also discuss how log shipping can be used to migrate to an Availability Group configuration, and other scenarios.

session.title: The T-SQL PIVOT/UNPIVOT Operators
session.description: Ever wish your horizontal data were vertical for easier data storage, as well as vice-versa for reporting purposes? Are you writing elaborate routines to transform between them for one-time usage? Are your queries repeating “OUTER JOIN” or “UNION” so often that you wind up back in Kansas when you read them aloud? Let's visit SQL Server’s lesser-known PIVOT and UNPIVOT operators. After this session, you will no longer need to rotate your monitor!

session.title: SQL Clinic Open
Ice Cream Break - Visit Sponsors
Charting New Territories: Unleashing Power BI's Custom Maps
session.description: In this session, we will explore the limitations and successes of mapping geographic data in Power BI. After exploring, the amazing features hidden in plain sight, we will dive deep into using geoJSON files to customize our maps. But the icing on the cake, is our custom topoJSON file creation and importation into Power BI. Users will be left ready to layer their own reports with amazing maps that tailor their data to new extremes!

session.title: 4 Examples of using Power Automate and Power Apps IN Power BI
session.description:
In this fast-paced session, Belinda will use an existing Power BI Reports, reporting on ERP (Accounting and Distribution) data, adding Power Apps and Power Automate flows to enrich the user experience and efficiency.  The ability to utilize apps and flows within a Power BI report allows you to act on your analysis without ever leaving the page.  During this session we will:
•	Build a Power App to change data at the source
•	Build multiple Power Automate flows
o	   Utilizing Paginated Reports
o	   Refreshing Data 
•	More
If you have never used the apps and flows in your Power BI Report, this session is for you!

session.title: Exploring the new performance "bugs", I mean, "features" of SQL2022
session.description:
The intelligent query processing (IQP) feature family includes features with broad impact that improve the performance of existing workloads with minimal implementation effort to adopt.

In this session we'll explore the the many features that comprise IQP. We'll see not only the good benefits of the features that work fine on AdventureWorks, but also some important considerations, limitations and potential improvements on the features.

session.title: Use AI To Make Your Data Job Easier (and More Fun)
session.description: Even a casual glance at the news lately shows that AI and the things it can do is all the rage. Is a lot of it overblown hype? Yes. But, does it enable technical professionals to do more than they could before? Also yes! I've been working with Azure AI for six years and it is exciting to see the convergency between low-code/no-code development tools and the power of AI in the cloud. Join me for this demo-rich session where I show you how AI-powered and connected tools can help you do your job more efficiently, help you have a little more fun at work, and possibly help you leverage your new found AI knowledge to a new job!

session.title: Deciphering Data Architectures (Modern Data Warehouse, Data Fabric, Data Lakehouse, Data Mesh)
session.description: Data fabric, data lakehouse, and data mesh have recently appeared as viable alternatives to the modern data warehouse. These new architectures have solid benefits, but they’re also surrounded by a lot of hyperbole and confusion. In this presentation I will give you a guided tour of each architecture to help you understand its pros and cons. I will also examine common data architecture concepts, including data warehouses and data lakes. You’ll learn what data lakehouses can help you achieve, and how to distinguish data mesh hype from reality. Best of all, you’ll be able to determine the most appropriate data architecture for your needs. And I’ll finish with discussing Microsoft’s version of the data mesh.

session.title: Analytics at the speed of Direct Lake
session.description: Join Patrick Leblanc and Phil Seamark for a deeper dive to discover what makes Direct Lake so fast.  This session will cover important elements of monitoring and optimizing your Fabric data platform to unlock the full potential of Direct Lake, such as how to interpret Delta Analyzer logs and what to look out for if things slow down.

session.title: Leadership Principles Uncovered...
session.description: There are many Managers in this world and every once in a while we come across a leaders.  We will go on a Journey as to what is a leader and what we can do to improve our ability to stay ahead of the curve and become a better leader.

session.title: Building a cloud based data pipeline from raw data to visualization
session.description: In this presentation, we take a look at a real use case where we need to create a cloud based big data pipeline from unstructured raw data and build a data visualization solution to enable business decisions. We use these technologies:  Python, Jupyter notebook, SQL, GitHub, Docker, Data Lake, Data Orchestration and Data Modeling for incremental data process into the Data Warehouse, which serves the data to Visualization tools like Looker or Power BI.

session.title: Maximizing Data Performance: Unlocking the Power of Delta Tables
session.description: Discover the essentials of Delta tables in this dynamic session. We'll focus on how Delta tables revolutionize data processing, offering faster, more reliable performance. Learn about key features like ACID transactions and scalable metadata handling, and see how they fit into your data strategies. With practical tips and case examples, you'll walk away with actionable insights to enhance your data operations. Perfect for data professionals eager to elevate their systems with cutting-edge technology. Join us to transform your data landscape with Delta tables!

session.title: This is not your daddy's backup routine
session.description: Microsoft introduced a new backup support back in SQL 2016 when the data files are in Azure Storage Accounts. It was yet another cloud native feature in SQL. After 6 years it has finally made its way to on-prem storage. In this session we will deep dive in the snapshot backup option, target to large volume data bases.

session.title: Running High IO SQL Server Workloads in the Cloud
session.description: We all have that one or two "whales in the pond" that we need to migrate to the cloud and know they can't go Azure SQL or even Managed Instance.  What options are there to run these IO intensive SQL workloads in the cloud?  This session will cover the ins and outs, including options for reaching high IO, no matter the workload.

session.title: Solving DBA Problems with Powershell
session.description: Let's face it, our data estates are growing while our Database Administration teams are not. How do we handle this? I will show you how PowerShell can transform common DBA tasks into easily packaged scripts that are faster and less error prone. When you leave, you will be equipped to solve DBA issues faster and be prepared for the ever-changing database landscape.

session.title: SQL Clinic Open
Ice Cream Break - Visit Sponsors
Generative AI: Concepts, Tools, and Applications for Data Professionals
session.description: Generative AI is a branch of artificial intelligence that can create new data or content by learning from existing content. It has applications in various domains such as text, image, audio, video, and code generation. In this session, you will learn how generative AI works, its limitations, the main tools and processes you can use, and where you can use it to enhance your data estate and data projects. You will also explore examples of how generative AI can help you with code generation, debugging, and optimization tasks. You will examine a complete solution using SQL SErver Machine Learning Services and Azure OpenAI integration. This session is suitable for data professionals who have some familiarity with machine learning and want to learn more about the potential and effective uses of generative AI.

session.title: ‘So Many Power BI Features, So Little Time: Susan’s Top Ten Best’
session.description:
With the Power BI Team cranking out monthly updates and new features at a mind-boggling rate, it’s hard to keep up with the new preview features.  To help you cut through the white noise, join Susan as she shows off her top ten favorites.
There are many new features to try each month, but we don’t have time to test everything in the real world.  So, let’s review the most value-added items we can put into play today in our models; ones that will bring along a ‘wow’ factor with a true value-add!  Keep in mind, this list is not even close to an extensive one.
The May 2023 Fabric Rollout aside, we’ll start the list with creative ways to leverage Field Parameters [previewed 2022], moving on to the New Card visual, Explore! In the Service, DAX INFO Functions, storytelling in PowerPoint and the list goes on…. well at least for 10 items; we only have one hour.  We can also debate the On-Object Interaction functionality, which takes a little time to get used to and then you can’t live without it!
To get the full list; come on over for a lively discussion and demo rich presentation.  There is always something new to learn; let’s learn together!

session.title: Teaching Old Dogs New Tricks:  Revitalizing a SQL Server Code Base One Version at a Time
session.description: Data assets at organizations tend to stick around for a while--many of the databases we work with are old enough to vote.  These databases tend to be full of code and patterns which made sense in SQL Server 2005 but are not the best approach today.  In this session, we will walk through what has changed in the T-SQL landscape over the past several versions of SQL Server, providing practical tips on how to improve an existing code base without installing new SQL Server components.  Just because that database is old doesn't mean it has to look that way.

session.title: Exceptions, temp tables and code regression
session.description: Try/Catch, #temp, ##temp or @temp, inner/left/outer joins and other T-SQL fundamentals to improve your database developer role

session.title: Lakehouse Plumbing - Building Metadata Driven Pipelines
session.description: If you are adopting cloud data technologies, you more than likely are going to need to move data up in them clouds so an ETL/pipeline process may be in your future.  Time and time again I have seen a pattern emerge that was helpful with my customers…metadata driven pipelines.  In this demo heavy session, we'll go through how to set them up in Azure Data Factory/Synapse Analytics.  We'll also look at how to set them up in Microsoft Fabric and compare those options.  By the end of this session, we may be calling ourselves pro data lakehouse plumbers.

session.title: Copilot in Power BI
session.description: Learn how this AI-powered digital assistant can help you with tasks such as writing DAX, creating synonyms, and building reports. Built on technologies from OpenAI, Copilot is designed to provide personalized assistance and suggestions, while respecting user-specific permissions and only generating responses based on information you have access to. Discover how Copilot can help you unleash your creativity, unlock productivity, and improve your skills in Power BI.

session.title: Power BI Basics! Design and Deliver Power(ful) BI Reports
session.description:
Have you struggled with presenting tabular/raw data effectively using the Power BI platform?

In this session you will learn a variety of ways to load & transform data, some report design techniques learned through years of on-hand experiences, and lastly you will learn how to create reports and dashboards that any busy Data Analyst can successfully implement.

session.title: Database Project 0 to 100 in 60
session.description: Only two slides and then we dive in. Basic navigation tools followed by handling of handling databases that reference each other followed by ignoring client objects with a single common structure. Bring your questions and we will dig in!

session.title: Introduction to Azure Data Factory
session.description: Your boss comes in one day and says that your company has decided to move to Azure and they want you to get up to speed on Azure Data Factory (ADF). Has this happened to you? If not, it may be coming!  Currently your processes use SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) and now you need to learn the basics of ADF just to get your existing processes converted. Or perhaps you have been wanting to learn more about how to load data using Azure Data Factory? If this is you, please join me in this introductory session where I will provide a quick overview and demonstration on loading a data mart in Azure Data Factory.

session.title: Tame Your Unruly Data With Constraints
session.description: Bad data comes in many forms: duplicate rows, wrong data type, invalid values, and orphaned or missing foreign keys. Time is wasted cleansing, reviewing and correcting data, not to mention the potential hazards bad data can cause. This introductory presentation will explain the data types and constraints available in SQL Server, and how they can replace or augment business rules that would otherwise be written in application or procedure code. Performance benefits provided by constraints will be demonstrated. We will examine the various system views and procedures that describe constraints and how to use them to document your databases. You will be able to apply this knowledge to your database environments and see significant improvements in data quality, performance, and reliability.

session.title: The hitchhiker's guide for keeping your SQL Server Always On
session.description:
In today's fast-paced business environment, high availability is critical for any SQL Server deployment. The SQL Server Always On Availability Groups feature is a powerful tool that provides a high level of availability and disaster recovery protection for your mission-critical databases. However, implementing and maintaining a robust Always On infrastructure can be challenging. 
In this session, we will dive into the world of SQL Server Always On Availability Groups and explore the best practices for keeping your SQL Server Always On by combining other features as well. We will cover the key components of an Always On deployment, including cluster configuration, network settings, database configuration, and monitoring. We will also discuss common issues that can impact the availability of your SQL Server environment and how to address them.

You will learn:
	• How to design and deploy a highly available SQL Server Always On infrastructure
	• Best practices for configuring and managing Always On Availability Groups
	• How to monitor and troubleshoot common issues with your Always On deployment
	• Tips and tricks for ensuring maximum availability and performance of your SQL Server environment
	
Whether you are a SQL Server dba, database developer, or IT professional responsible for managing SQL Server deployments, this session will provide you with the knowledge and tools you need to keep your SQL Server Always On and minimize its downtime.

session.title: PowerShell For the SQL Server DBA
session.description: During this session we will cover the basics of PowerShell and how we can use it to help us do our job.  We will go over the fundamentals of PowerShell including some basic commands.  We will also go over the places in the SQL Server environment that PowerShell can be used.  This session is for the DBA who has little or no knowledge of PowerShell

session.title: Final Break - Head to Raffle
Raffle
